Instrument.name: DENIS 3-Channel Near-Infrared Camera
Instrument.description: The DENIS (Deep European Near-Infrared southern sky Survey) instrument is a 3-channel camera developed by the Observatoire de Paris with input from several European institutions. It was utilized for the DENIS survey at the ESO 1.0 meter telescope in La Silla, Chile, and features different characteristics for its I, J, and Ks channels, including various wavelengths, array sizes, and quantum efficiencies. The instrumentâ€™s specifications include read-out noise, exposure times, and limiting magnitudes, making it capable of detecting faint celestial sources. For detailed information about the DENIS instrument, refer to the work of Epchtein (1997).
